--- title: "Veg Non Veg" author: "Hardik Monga" --- ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library(tidyverse) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` ── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ── ✔ dplyr 1.1.4 ✔ readr 2.1.5 ✔ forcats 1.0.0 ✔ stringr 1.5.1 ✔ ggplot2 3.5.1 ✔ tibble 3.2.1 ✔ lubridate 1.9.3 ✔ tidyr 1.3.1 ✔ purrr 1.0.2 ── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ── ✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter() ✖ dplyr::lag() masks stats::lag() ℹ Use the conflicted package () to force all conflicts to become errors ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} library(mosaic) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` Registered S3 method overwritten by 'mosaic': method from fortify.SpatialPolygonsDataFrame ggplot2 The 'mosaic' package masks several functions from core packages in order to add additional features. The original behavior of these functions should not be affected by this. Attaching package: 'mosaic' The following object is masked from 'package:Matrix': mean The following objects are masked from 'package:dplyr': count, do, tally The following object is masked from 'package:purrr': cross The following object is masked from 'package:ggplot2': stat The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': binom.test, cor, cor.test, cov, fivenum, IQR, median, prop.test, quantile, sd, t.test, var The following objects are masked from 'package:base': max, mean, min, prod, range, sample, sum ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} library(skimr) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` Attaching package: 'skimr' The following object is masked from 'package:mosaic': n_missing ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} library(dplyr) library(ggformula) library(crosstable) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` Attaching package: 'crosstable' The following object is masked from 'package:purrr': compact ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} library(ggridges) ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} tip_data<- read_delim(file = "../../data/tip.csv") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` Rows: 60 Columns: 4 ── Column specification ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────── Delimiter: "," chr (3): Name, Gender, Food preferance dbl (1): Tip ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data. ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message. ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} tip_data ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 60 × 4 Name Gender `Food preferance` Tip 1 Aanya Female Veg 0 2 Adit Male Veg 0 3 Aditi Female Veg 20 4 Akash Male Non-veg 0 5 Akshita Female Non-veg 0 6 Anandita Female Non-veg 0 7 Ananya Female Non-veg 20 8 Ananya Female Veg 35 9 Anhuya Female Veg 40 10 Ankit Male Non-veg 0 # ℹ 50 more rows ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} inspect(tip_data) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` categorical variables: name class levels n missing 1 Name character 58 60 0 2 Gender character 2 60 0 3 Food preferance character 2 60 0 distribution 1 Ananya (3.3%), Simran (3.3%) ... 2 Female (50%), Male (50%) 3 Non-veg (50%), Veg (50%) quantitative variables: name class min Q1 median Q3 max mean sd n missing 1 Tip numeric 0 0 0 20 100 11.16667 17.83556 60 0 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} skim(tip_data) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} Table: Data summary | | | |:------------------------|:--------| |Name |tip_data | |Number of rows |60 | |Number of columns |4 | |_______________________ | | |Column type frequency: | | |character |3 | |numeric |1 | |________________________ | | |Group variables |None | **Variable type: character** |skim_variable | n_missing| complete_rate| min| max| empty| n_unique| whitespace| |:---------------|---------:|-------------:|---:|---:|-----:|--------:|----------:| |Name | 0| 1| 4| 9| 0| 58| 0| |Gender | 0| 1| 4| 6| 0| 2| 0| |Food preferance | 0| 1| 3| 7| 0| 2| 0| **Variable type: numeric** |skim_variable | n_missing| complete_rate| mean| sd| p0| p25| p50| p75| p100|hist | |:-------------|---------:|-------------:|-----:|-----:|--:|---:|---:|---:|----:|:-----| |Tip | 0| 1| 11.17| 17.84| 0| 0| 0| 20| 100|▇▁▁▁▁ | ::: ```{.r .cell-code} glimpse(tip_data) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Rows: 60 Columns: 4 $ Name "Aanya", "Adit", "Aditi", "Akash", "Akshita", "Anand… $ Gender "Female", "Male", "Female", "Male", "Female", "Femal… $ `Food preferance` "Veg", "Veg", "Veg", "Non-veg", "Non-veg", "Non-veg"… $ Tip 0, 0, 20, 0, 0, 0, 20, 35, 40, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, … ``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} tip_mod <- tip_data %>% dplyr::mutate( pref = as_factor(`Food preferance`)) tip_mod ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 60 × 5 Name Gender `Food preferance` Tip pref 1 Aanya Female Veg 0 Veg 2 Adit Male Veg 0 Veg 3 Aditi Female Veg 20 Veg 4 Akash Male Non-veg 0 Non-veg 5 Akshita Female Non-veg 0 Non-veg 6 Anandita Female Non-veg 0 Non-veg 7 Ananya Female Non-veg 20 Non-veg 8 Ananya Female Veg 35 Veg 9 Anhuya Female Veg 40 Veg 10 Ankit Male Non-veg 0 Non-veg # ℹ 50 more rows ``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} tip_mod%>% group_by(Gender) %>% summarize(average_tip = mean(Tip),count = n()) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 2 × 3 Gender average_tip count 1 Female 12.2 30 2 Male 10.2 30 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} tip_mod%>% group_by(pref) %>% summarize(average_tip = mean(Tip),count = n()) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 2 × 3 pref average_tip count 1 Veg 12.3 30 2 Non-veg 10 30 ``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} tip_mod%>%crosstable(Tip~pref) %>% as_flextable() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}

``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} mosaic::t_test(Tip~pref, data = tip_mod) %>% broom::tidy() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 1 × 10 estimate estimate1 estimate2 statistic p.value parameter conf.low conf.high 1 2.33 12.3 10 0.503 0.617 46.9 -6.99 11.7 # ℹ 2 more variables: method , alternative ``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} gf_histogram(~Tip, fill = ~pref, data = tip_mod) %>% gf_labs( title = "Tips: Veg vs Non-Veg" ) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](index_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-7-1.png){width=672} ::: ```{.r .cell-code} gf_histogram(~Tip, fill = ~Gender, data = tip_mod) %>% gf_labs( title = "Tips: Male vs Female" ) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](index_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-7-2.png){width=672} ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} gf_density_ridges(pref ~ Tip, data = tip_mod, alpha = 0.5, fill = ~ pref) + labs(title = "Density of Tips for Veg and Non-veg Preferences", x = "Tip Amount", y = "Food Preference") + scale_fill_manual(values = c("Veg" = "green", "Non-veg" = "red")) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` Picking joint bandwidth of 6.33 ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](index_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-8-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: # Inference - Female students tend to tip slightly more, with an average tip of 12.17, compared to male students, who average around 10.17. This might hint at a marginally more generous tipping tendency among female students. - Vegetarian students show a higher average tip (12.33) than those who prefer non-veg options (10.00), suggesting a subtle association between vegetarian preference and a higher likelihood of tipping. - A large proportion of students in all groups did not tip, which might reflect a general attitude among college students that tipping is less essential or simply optional, potentially shaped by budget constraints common in student life.
